After a few technical issues to get started I have worked out where I went wrong with syncing the phone to Bluetooth. As you are aware the destructionanual isn't too clear and the app is not very user friendly. So please let me simplify for all. 1. Turn your blue tooth on but do not try and sync the watch directly 2. Download the app Gloryfit. Use your email to log in first time then following time you go to the app hit the IGNORE button 3. Go through the setup, the app will sync your watch.

The Gloryfit app's heart BPM results are incorrect. When the Ddidbi P66E watch's BPM results are synchronised, the app updates the minimum BPM and maximum BPM to match the watch's results, and sets the average BPM to the minimum BPM value (incorrect). Shortly afterwards, it resets all BPM values back to their pre-synchronisation values. I don't know where it gets its early-day values from, but they are incorrect by midday. The watch is not at fault as the app clearly receives the watch data.

For those having issues about bluetooth disconnected, disconnect band error, this is due to your phone trying to save battery and thus has set a short timeout. Go to your bluetooth settings change timeout from 15 seconds to any timeframe you think will be ok for you to finish whatever you do in the app and you will be ok.

Pros: Battery lasts 8 days & charges in less than 2 hours. (I only use the health diagnostics and have all the other notifications turned off). Detailed info is quickly available on the app., unlike my fitbit that took forever to sync with my phone. Cons: Heart rate readings are so inaccurate. The watch will give a reading above 100 compared to my fingertip oximeter, wrist blood pressure cuff and even a manual check will be in the low 50's! I can't get the body temp. or weather to read in Fahrenheit . Most of the watch faces look like they were made for a child's watch. They are cluttered with graphics and multiple colors making it hard to get info at a glance. Very few show the battery level and only 1 gives the actual battery percentage. There is no way to track basic workout activities like elliptical, rowing or weight training. But they list badminton and yoga! The watch is not waterproof & they caution if wearing it while washing your hands! This item might work for some people, but I feel it was a waste of money.

Works quite well. Using an "F12" smartwatch everything seams to work it even was able to update firmware from 00413 to 00452. Blood pressure is a different issue however, lots of people say BP is wrong reading. Medical blood pressure is nearly always taken via the brachial, which is the normal accepted BP in medical industry, Any smart watch takes radial blood pressure. My research shows that the radial BP is something like 20 to 30 mmhg lower reading than brachial BP so to adjust BP add 30.

Worked until an apparent update by either Skygrand or Gloryfit. Now, the watch, Skygrand3194, will not connect to Gloryfit. Everything appears to be normal when attempting to connect my Android based Pixel3 Excel to the Skygrand watch using Gloryfit until an attempt is made to make the actual connection. Gloryfit recognizes the Skygrand 3194 watch but refuses to connect to it. I've tried multiple times to make the connection including shutting the watch on and off, the Pixel3 Excel phone on and off, uninstalling Gloryfit and then reinstalling it, and reviewing and verifying passwords on the cell phone. To my knowledge, no password exists on the Skygrand watch. Currently, Gloryfit is a piece of junk and unusable. The watch's usefulness is compromised and is little more than a watch that measures pulse rate, steps taken, and distance. Unless there is someone who can help me through this imbroglio, I'll have to discard the watch and get a superior one, perhaps from Apple, Fitbit, or the better watches on Amazon. Phone support from Gloryfit would be the most desirable. Although initially pleased with the watch, I now regard it as compromised and Glory Fit as a piece of junk.

Don't get me wrong, the watch and the app look ok, but there are a ton of flaws in both. For example, my watch clasp never seems to stay hooked. I've tried tightening it, loosening it, clasping it, I've tried everything and it still falls off 90% of the time. I have to reclasp it almost every 10 minutes and I'm afraid it might fall off while working. Another example would be my watch was running low on battery and I went to charge it with the charger it came with. The first time I charged it, it worked fine, but this time after about 30 minutes or so, I heard it vibrating like crazy. I went to check on it and turn it on, but now it won't even turn on! It will still vibrate when I plug it in, but the screen is completely dead and I can't do anything on it anymore. On top of all that, the watch RARELY connects to the app! It connected maybe once or twice, but every time, I tried restarting my phone, turning Bluetooth on and off, turning the watch on and off, but it NEVER connected! Plus when the watch said it was connected to my phone, any changes I made in the Settings on the app never applied to the watch itself (it stayed on 24 hour time and stayed in Celcius when I wanted 12 hour time and Farenheit.) Really the only good thing about this watch is that it can count my steps. Buyers beware, it's best to buy a different smartwatch or a different product, this one is faulty.

The app crashes ALL THE TIME! Seriously, EVERY time I hit the back button, the app crashes. I can start it, look at different menus, sync,...but as soon as I want to move up a menu using the back arrow...CRASH! I tried to install it to a tablet, and it won't...it HAS to be a phone, and you HAVE to give this app almost full control of your phone.
